No. 22373)} Sub: Mishap/ falling down of passenger bus from Bridge into Narmada River on NH- 3 (Agra-Mumbai Road) near Khalghat in Madhya Pradesh o 18.07.2022-reg: Recently, an accident took place on NH-52 in Madhya Pradesh, wherein a Bus after hitting the railing, fallen into the river leading to loss of lives. This raised an issue about possibility of replacing railing with crash barriers in accordance with latest Standards & Specifications of IRC. 2 _ IRC keeps on upgrading its specifications to provide better engineering aspects, user satisfaction, safety of commuters etc Therefore, the endeavour of the field officers should be to examine the implementability of upgraded Standards &t Specifications in the existing projects. A detailed study should be carried out while framing such proposals. This study shall invariably include history of the structure/ project; its performance in the past, its design & structural adequacy to take additional loads due to proposed modification, availability of space to accommodate proposed changes, expected improvement in terms of safety/ user satisfaction, cost involved in relation to the betterment, etc. 3 Project Directors are requested to all the projects including structures, inspected and submit feasible measures based on current Standards & Specifications of IRC. The broad proposals in this regard, project-wise be framed and submitted to Tech: Division at HQ within 15 days. It may be noted that the proposals are to be executed only after detailed studies & approval of cost by Competent Authority. 4_ This issues with the approval of Competent Authority. 09) (Sanjay Kumar Patel) General Manager (Coord.)
